description: Updates the configuration of an identity pool. You must use Amazon Web Services developer credentials to call this operation.

parameters.name: IdentityPoolId
parameters.description: An identity pool ID in the format REGION:GUID.

parameters.name: AllowUnauthenticatedIdentities
parameters.description: TRUE if the identity pool supports unauthenticated logins.

parameters.name: SupportedLoginProviders
parameters.description: Optional key:value pairs mapping provider names to provider app IDs. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: OpenIdConnectProviderARNs
parameters.description: The ARNs of the OpenID Connect providers. (string) ---

parameters.name: CognitoIdentityProviders
parameters.description: A list representing an Amazon Cognito user pool and its client ID. (dict) --- A provider representing an Amazon Cognito user pool and its client ID. ProviderName (string) --- The provider name for an Amazon Cognito user pool. For example, cognito-idp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/us-east-1_123456789. ClientId (string) --- The client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pool. ServerSideTokenCheck (boolean) --- TRUE if server-side token validation is enabled for the identity provider's token. Once you set ServerSideTokenCheck to TRUE for an identity pool, that identity pool will check with the integrated user pools to make sure that the user has not been globally signed out or deleted before the identity pool provides an OIDC token or Amazon Web Services credentials for the user. If the user is signed out or deleted, the identity pool will return a 400 Not Authorized error.

nested_params.name: ProviderName
nested_params.description: The provider name for an Amazon Cognito user pool. For example, cognito-idp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/us-east-1_123456789.

nested_params.name: ClientId
nested_params.description: The client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pool.

nested_params.name: ServerSideTokenCheck
nested_params.description: TRUE if server-side token validation is enabled for the identity provider's token. Once you set ServerSideTokenCheck to TRUE for an identity pool, that identity pool will check with the integrated user pools to make sure that the user has not been globally signed out or deleted before the identity pool provides an OIDC token or Amazon Web Services credentials for the user. If the user is signed out or deleted, the identity pool will return a 400 Not Authorized error.

parameters.name: SamlProviderARNs
parameters.description: An array of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the SAML provider for your identity pool. (string) ---

parameters.name: IdentityPoolTags
parameters.description: The tags that are assigned to the identity pool. A tag is a label that you can apply to identity pools to categorize and manage them in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: IdentityPoolId
nested_items.description: An identity pool ID in the format REGION:GUID.

nested_items.name: AllowUnauthenticatedIdentities
nested_items.description: TRUE if the identity pool supports unauthenticated logins.

nested_items.name: AllowClassicFlow
nested_items.description: Enables or disables the Basic (Classic) authentication flow. For more information, see Identity Pools (Federated Identities) Authentication Flow in the Amazon Cognito Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: SupportedLoginProviders
nested_items.description: Optional key:value pairs mapping provider names to provider app IDs.

nested_items.name: DeveloperProviderName
nested_items.description: The 'domain' by which Cognito will refer to your users.

nested_items.name: OpenIdConnectProviderARNs
nested_items.description: The ARNs of the OpenID Connect providers.

nested_items.name: CognitoIdentityProviders
nested_items.description: A list representing an Amazon Cognito user pool and its client ID.

nested_items.name: ProviderName
nested_items.description: The provider name for an Amazon Cognito user pool. For example, cognito-idp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/us-east-1_123456789.

nested_items.name: ClientId
nested_items.description: The client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pool.

nested_items.name: ServerSideTokenCheck
nested_items.description: TRUE if server-side token validation is enabled for the identity provider's token.

nested_items.name: SamlProviderARNs
nested_items.description: An array of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the SAML provider for your identity pool.

nested_items.name: IdentityPoolTags
nested_items.description: The tags that are assigned to the identity pool. A tag is a label that you can apply to identity pools to categorize and manage them in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria.
